data.price: Blessed is He in Whose Hand is the dominion, and He is Most Capable of all things.
data.arabic: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱلَّذِي بِيَدِهِ ٱلۡمُلۡكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ

meta.transliteration: tabāraka alladhī biyadihi al-mul'ku wahuwa ʿalā kulli shayin qadīrun

data.price: Who created death and life to test you as to which of you is best in deeds, and He is the All-Mighty, the Most Forgiving.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ لِيَبۡلُوَكُمۡ أَيُّكُمۡ أَحۡسَنُ عَمَلٗاۚ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡغَفُورُ

meta.transliteration: alladhī khalaqa al-mawta wal-ḥayata liyabluwakum ayyukum aḥsanu ʿamalan wahuwa al-ʿazīzu al-ghafūru

data.price: Who created seven heavens one above another; you will not see any imperfection[1] in the creation of the Most Compassionate. Look again; can you see any flaw?
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗاۖ مَّا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلۡقِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مِن تَفَٰوُتٖۖ فَٱرۡجِعِ ٱلۡبَصَرَ هَلۡ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٖ
data.footnotes: [1] All parts of the universe are well connected and in perfect harmony and coordination. There is no indiscipline, disorder and discordance in the universe, and nothing is disjointed and out of proportion in the creation of Allah. As for birth defects, genetic mutations and other things that we see in the world are part of this great creation, for perfection cannot be noticed except if the opposite is seen, also as a test for humans.

meta.transliteration: alladhī khalaqa sabʿa samāwātin ṭibāqan mā tarā fī khalqi al-raḥmāni min tafāwutin fa-ir'jiʿi al-baṣara hal tarā min fuṭūrin

data.price: Then look again and again; your sight will turn back to you humbled and weary.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱرۡجِعِ ٱلۡبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيۡنِ يَنقَلِبۡ إِلَيۡكَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ خَاسِئٗا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٞ

meta.transliteration: thumma ir'jiʿi al-baṣara karratayni yanqalib ilayka al-baṣaru khāsi-an wahuwa ḥasīrun

data.price: We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and have made them as missiles to stone the devils[2], and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِمَصَٰبِيحَ وَجَعَلۡنَٰهَا رُجُومٗا لِّلشَّيَٰطِينِۖ وَأَعۡتَدۡنَا لَهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
data.footnotes: [2] Preventing them thereby from eavesdropping in the heavens. See 72:8-10.

meta.transliteration: walaqad zayyannā al-samāa al-dun'yā bimaṣābīḥa wajaʿalnāhā rujūman lilshayāṭīni wa-aʿtadnā lahum ʿadhāba al-saʿīri

data.price: For those who disbelieve in their Lord there will be the punishment of Hell. What a terrible destination!
data.arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِرَبِّهِمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

meta.transliteration: walilladhīna kafarū birabbihim ʿadhābu jahannama wabi'sa al-maṣīru

data.price: When they are thrown in it, they will hear its roaring as it boils up,
data.arabic: إِذَآ أُلۡقُواْ فِيهَا سَمِعُواْ لَهَا شَهِيقٗا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

meta.transliteration: idhā ul'qū fīhā samiʿū lahā shahīqan wahiya tafūru

data.price: almost bursting in fury. Every time a group is thrown in it, its keepers will ask them, “Did there not come to you a warner?”
data.arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلۡغَيۡظِۖ كُلَّمَآ أُلۡقِيَ فِيهَا فَوۡجٞ سَأَلَهُمۡ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمۡ يَأۡتِكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ

meta.transliteration: takādu tamayyazu mina al-ghayẓi kullamā ul'qiya fīhā fawjun sa-alahum khazanatuhā alam yatikum nadhīrun

data.price: They will say, “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied and said, ‘Allah has not sent down anything; you are greatly misguided.’”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلَىٰ قَدۡ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٞ فَكَذَّبۡنَا وَقُلۡنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَيۡءٍ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَٰلٖ كَبِيرٖ

meta.transliteration: qālū balā qad jāanā nadhīrun fakadhabnā waqul'nā mā nazzala al-lahu min shayin in antum illā fī ḍalālin kabīrin

data.price: And they will say, “If only we had listened or understood, we would not be among the dwellers of the Blazing Fire.”
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ لَوۡ كُنَّا نَسۡمَعُ أَوۡ نَعۡقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِيٓ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ

meta.transliteration: waqālū law kunnā nasmaʿu aw naʿqilu mā kunnā fī aṣḥābi al-saʿīri

data.price: Thus they will confess their sins. So away[3] with the dwellers of the Blazing Fire!
data.footnotes: [3] Away from all good and from the mercy of Allah.

data.price: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and a great reward.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخۡشَوۡنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ لَهُم مَّغۡفِرَةٞ وَأَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٞ

meta.transliteration: inna alladhīna yakhshawna rabbahum bil-ghaybi lahum maghfiratun wa-ajrun kabīrun

data.price: Whether you speak secretly or openly, He is All-Knowing of that which is in the hearts.
data.arabic: وَأَسِرُّواْ قَوۡلَكُمۡ أَوِ ٱجۡهَرُواْ بِهِۦٓۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

meta.transliteration: wa-asirrū qawlakum awi ij'harū bihi innahu ʿalīmun bidhāti al-ṣudūri

data.price: Does He not know His Own creation[4], when He is the Most Subtle, the All-Aware?
data.arabic: أَلَا يَعۡلَمُ مَنۡ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلۡخَبِيرُ
data.footnotes: [4] Or does He not know those whom He created?

meta.transliteration: alā yaʿlamu man khalaqa wahuwa al-laṭīfu al-khabīru

data.price: It is He Who made the earth smooth[5] for you, so travel through its regions and eat from His provisions. And to Him is the resurrection.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ ذَلُولٗا فَٱمۡشُواْ فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُواْ مِن رِّزۡقِهِۦۖ وَإِلَيۡهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., subservient and stable.

meta.transliteration: huwa alladhī jaʿala lakumu al-arḍa dhalūlan fa-im'shū fī manākibihā wakulū min riz'qihi wa-ilayhi al-nushūru

data.price: Do you feel secure that He Who is above heaven will not cause the earth to sink with you, and then suddenly convulse[6]?
data.arabic: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخۡسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ
data.footnotes: [6] In a circular motion.

meta.transliteration: a-amintum man fī al-samāi an yakhsifa bikumu al-arḍa fa-idhā hiya tamūru

data.price: Do you feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not send against you a storm of stones? Only then would you know how [serious] My warning was!
data.arabic: أَمۡ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ حَاصِبٗاۖ فَسَتَعۡلَمُونَ كَيۡفَ نَذِيرِ

meta.transliteration: am amintum man fī al-samāi an yur'sila ʿalaykum ḥāṣiban fasataʿlamūna kayfa nadhīri

data.price: Those who came before them rejected [the messengers]; then how severe was My response!
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

meta.transliteration: walaqad kadhaba alladhīna min qablihim fakayfa kāna nakīri

data.price: Do they not see the birds above them, spreading out and folding in their wings? None holds them up except the Most Compassionate. He is indeed All-Seeing of everything.
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلطَّيۡرِ فَوۡقَهُمۡ صَٰٓفَّٰتٖ وَيَقۡبِضۡنَۚ مَا يُمۡسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءِۭ بَصِيرٌ

meta.transliteration: awalam yaraw ilā al-ṭayri fawqahum ṣāffātin wayaqbiḍ'na mā yum'sikuhunna illā al-raḥmānu innahu bikulli shayin baṣīrun

data.price: Which is your army that can come to your aid against the Most Compassionate? The disbelievers are in utter delusion.
data.arabic: أَمَّنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي هُوَ جُندٞ لَّكُمۡ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۚ إِنِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ

meta.transliteration: amman hādhā alladhī huwa jundun lakum yanṣurukum min dūni al-raḥmāni ini al-kāfirūna illā fī ghurūrin

data.price: Who is there to give you provision if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in arrogance and aversion.
data.arabic: أَمَّنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي يَرۡزُقُكُمۡ إِنۡ أَمۡسَكَ رِزۡقَهُۥۚ بَل لَّجُّواْ فِي عُتُوّٖ وَنُفُورٍ

meta.transliteration: amman hādhā alladhī yarzuqukum in amsaka riz'qahu bal lajjū fī ʿutuwwin wanufūrin

data.price: Who is better guided: the one who walks stumbling and falling on his face or the one who walks upright on a straight path?
data.arabic: أَفَمَن يَمۡشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجۡهِهِۦٓ أَهۡدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمۡشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ

meta.transliteration: afaman yamshī mukibban ʿalā wajhihi ahdā amman yamshī sawiyyan ʿalā ṣirāṭin mus'taqīmin

data.price: Say, “It is He Who brought you into being and gave you hearing, sight, and hearts; little do you give thanks.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنشَأَكُمۡ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرَ وَٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةَۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَشۡكُرُونَ

meta.transliteration: qul huwa alladhī ansha-akum wajaʿala lakumu al-samʿa wal-abṣāra wal-afidata qalīlan mā tashkurūna

data.price: Say, “It is He Who has dispersed you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِلَيۡهِ تُحۡشَرُونَ

meta.transliteration: qul huwa alladhī dhara-akum fī al-arḍi wa-ilayhi tuḥ'sharūna

data.price: They say: “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

meta.transliteration: wayaqūlūna matā hādhā al-waʿdu in kuntum ṣādiqīna

data.price: Say, “That knowledge is with Allah alone, and I am only a clear warner.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَا ٱلۡعِلۡمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ

meta.transliteration: qul innamā al-ʿil'mu ʿinda al-lahi wa-innamā anā nadhīrun mubīnun

data.price: Then when they see it[7] approaching closer, the faces of the disbelievers will be distressed, and it will be said, “This is what you were asking for[8].”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوۡهُ زُلۡفَةٗ سِيٓـَٔتۡ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
data.footnotes:
[7] The punishment on the Day of Judgment of which they were warned.
 [8] As they were challenging their prophets, saying, "Bring upon us the punishment, if you are truthful."

meta.transliteration: falammā ra-awhu zul'fatan sīat wujūhu alladhīna kafarū waqīla hādhā alladhī kuntum bihi taddaʿūna

data.price: Say, “What do you think[9], if Allah causes me and those who are with me to die or shows us mercy, who will save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِنۡ أَهۡلَكَنِيَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِيَ أَوۡ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ مِنۡ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., Inform me.

meta.transliteration: qul ara-aytum in ahlakaniya al-lahu waman maʿiya aw raḥimanā faman yujīru al-kāfirīna min ʿadhābin alīmin

data.price: Say, “He is the Most Compassionate; we believe in Him and put our trust in Him. You will come to know who is clearly misguided.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيۡهِ تَوَكَّلۡنَاۖ فَسَتَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ هُوَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ

meta.transliteration: qul huwa al-raḥmānu āmannā bihi waʿalayhi tawakkalnā fasataʿlamūna man huwa fī ḍalālin mubīnin

data.price: Say, “What do you think, if your water were to sink deep into the earth, who can bring you flowing water?”
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِنۡ أَصۡبَحَ مَآؤُكُمۡ غَوۡرٗا فَمَن يَأۡتِيكُم بِمَآءٖ مَّعِينِۭ

meta.transliteration: qul ara-aytum in aṣbaḥa māukum ghawran faman yatīkum bimāin maʿīnin

data.price: Nūn[1]. By the pen and what they [i.e., the angels] write [in the Records of deeds],
data.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

data.price: By the grace of your Lord [O Prophet], you are not a madman.
You will surely have a never-ending reward.
Indeed, you are of a great moral character.
Soon you will see and they will see,
which of you is afflicted with madness.
Indeed, your Lord alone knows best who has strayed from His way and those who are rightly guided.
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِٱلۡمُهۡتَدِينَ

meta.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa aʿlamu biman ḍalla ʿan sabīlihi wahuwa aʿlamu bil-muh'tadīna

data.price: So do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would compromise so they would too compromise.
And do not obey every disgraceful swearer,
backbiter, gossip-monger,
withholder of good, transgressor, sinful,
coarse, and furthermore, an illegitimate child[2].
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., falsely claiming a particular lineage. It refers to Al-Walīd ibn al-Mughīrah (See also 74:11-25) or possibly Al-Akhnas ibn Shurayq.

data.price: Simply because he has wealth and children,
When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables!”
data.arabic: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

meta.transliteration: idhā tut'lā ʿalayhi āyātunā qāla asāṭīru al-awalīna

data.price: We will soon brand him on the snout[3].
data.footnotes: [3] Lit., "trunk," meaning the nose of an elephant or pig. These verses refer to Al-Walīd ibn al-Mughīrah, a leader of the pagans of Makkah and a staunch enemy of Islam. He called the Prophet (ﷺ) a madman, so the Qur’an responded by mentioning ten of Al-Walīd’s qualities. (See 53:33-35 and 74:11-26). Two of those qualities were not known to him: the fact that he was an illegitimate child and that his nose would be chopped off years later at the Battle of Badr. Khālid ibn al-Walīd and two of his brothers embraced Islam.

data.price: Indeed, We have tested them [i.e., the Makkans] as We tested the people of the garden when they swore to harvest its fruits in the early morning,
data.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوۡنَٰهُمۡ كَمَا بَلَوۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ إِذۡ أَقۡسَمُواْ لَيَصۡرِمُنَّهَا مُصۡبِحِينَ

meta.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣḥāba al-janati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣ'biḥīna

data.price: and made no exception [by saying: if Allah wills][4].
data.footnotes: [4] Or without leaving some for the poor.

data.price: Then it was struck by an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep,
data.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيۡهَا طَآئِفٞ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمۡ نَآئِمُونَ

meta.transliteration: faṭāfa ʿalayhā ṭāifun min rabbika wahum nāimūna

data.price: and it turned to ashes [as black as night].
Then in the early morning they called out to one another:
“Go early to your garden if you really wish to harvest.”
data.arabic: أَنِ ٱغۡدُواْ عَلَىٰ حَرۡثِكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰرِمِينَ

meta.transliteration: ani igh'dū ʿalā ḥarthikum in kuntum ṣārimīna

data.price: So they set out, whispering to one another,
“Not a single poor person should enter your garden today.”
data.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدۡخُلَنَّهَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّسۡكِينٞ

meta.transliteration: an lā yadkhulannahā al-yawma ʿalaykum mis'kīnun

data.price: And they left early, fully determined to stick to their plan[5].
data.footnotes: [5] To implement their plan, fully confident of their ability.

data.price: But when they saw the garden, they said, “We must have lost our way!
Rather, we have been deprived.”
The best among them said, “Did I not say to you to glorify Allah[6]?”
data.arabic: قَالَ أَوۡسَطُهُمۡ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ لَوۡلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., remember Him by saying, "...if Allah wills." Or "praise" and "thank" Allah for His bounty.

meta.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūna

data.price: They said, “Glory be to our Lord! We were truly wrongdoers.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

meta.transliteration: qālū sub'ḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīna

data.price: Then they turned to one another, throwing blame.
They said, “Woe to us! We were surely transgressors.
Our Lord may give us something better than this. We certainly turn to our Lord in hope[7].”
data.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبۡدِلَنَا خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [7] Of His forgiveness and bounty.

meta.transliteration: ʿasā rabbunā an yub'dilanā khayran min'hā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūna

data.price: Such is the punishment [in this world]; but the punishment of the Hereafter is far worse, if only they knew.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡعَذَابُۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ أَكۡبَرُۚ لَوۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡلَمُونَ

meta.transliteration: kadhālika al-ʿadhābu walaʿadhābu al-ākhirati akbaru law kānū yaʿlamūna

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will have gardens of bliss with their Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

meta.transliteration: inna lil'muttaqīna ʿinda rabbihim jannāti al-naʿīmi

data.price: Should We then treat Muslims like the wicked?
What is the matter with you that you make such a judgment?
Or do you have a scripture in which you read
that you will be given whatever you choose?
Or do you have a solemn promise binding upon Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you decide for yourselves?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ أَيۡمَٰنٌ عَلَيۡنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمۡ لَمَا تَحۡكُمُونَ

meta.transliteration: am lakum aymānun ʿalaynā bālighatun ilā yawmi al-qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūna

data.price: Ask them which of them can guarantee that.
Or do they have associate-gods? Then let them bring forth their associate-gods[8], if they are truthful.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شُرَكَآءُ فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمۡ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [8] whom they took as partners with Allah.

meta.transliteration: am lahum shurakāu falyatū bishurakāihim in kānū ṣādiqīna

data.price: On the Day when the Shin [of Allah] will be uncovered[9], and they are invited to prostrate, but they will not be able to do so.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُكۡشَفُ عَن سَاقٖ وَيُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., It is a Day that everyone will find before him great difficulty. According to a long and authentic Hadīth of Abu Sa‘īd al-Khudrī, "the Shin" refers to that of Allah Almighty, before which every believer will prostrate on the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and hypocrites will not be able to prostrate. The text of the Hadith is as follows: "... Then the Lord will uncover His Shank, so they will prostrate to Him...".

meta.transliteration: yawma yuk'shafu ʿan sāqin wayud'ʿawna ilā al-sujūdi falā yastaṭīʿūna

data.price: Their eyes will be downcast, overwhelmed with humiliation, for they were invited to prostrate when they were capable[10] [but they refused].
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۖ وَقَدۡ كَانُواْ يُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمۡ سَٰلِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [10] During the life of this world.

meta.transliteration: khāshiʿatan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillatun waqad kānū yud'ʿawna ilā al-sujūdi wahum sālimūna

data.price: So leave to Me those who reject this message [O Prophet]. We will gradually lead them to their ruin in ways that they do not perceive[11].
data.arabic: فَذَرۡنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِۖ سَنَسۡتَدۡرِجُهُم مِّنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [11] Allah will increase favors upon them in this life as a trial, so they will increase sin, which will lead to their destruction.

meta.transliteration: fadharnī waman yukadhibu bihādhā al-ḥadīthi sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā yaʿlamūna

data.price: I will give them respite, but My plan is firm.
Or are you asking them for a reward, so they find it too burdensome?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

meta.transliteration: am tasaluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muth'qalūna

data.price: Or do they have knowledge of the unseen, so they write it down?
So be patient with the decree of your Lord, and do not be like the man of the Whale [i.e., Jonah], when he cried out in anguish[12].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلۡحُوتِ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكۡظُومٞ
data.footnotes: [12] While inside the belly of the whale. See 21:87 and 37:139-148.

meta.transliteration: fa-iṣ'bir liḥuk'mi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibi al-ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūmun

data.price: Had it not been for the grace that he received from his Lord, he would have surely been thrown onto the barren shore, blameworthy[13].
data.arabic: لَّوۡلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعۡمَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذۡمُومٞ
data.footnotes: [13] Instead, Allah accepted his repentance and provided for him means of recovery. See 37:139-148.

meta.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu niʿ'matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil-ʿarāi wahuwa madhmūmun
translations: surely he would have been thrown

data.price: But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.
The disbelievers would almost strike you down with their malicious gazes when they hear the Reminder, and they say, “He is certainly mad.”
data.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَيُزۡلِقُونَكَ بِأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡ لَمَّا سَمِعُواْ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

meta.transliteration: wa-in yakādu alladhīna kafarū layuz'liqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā samiʿū al-dhik'ra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūnun

data.price: But it is nothing other than a reminder to the whole world.
The Inevitable Hour!
What is the Inevitable Hour?
How do you know what the Inevitable Hour is?
Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the Striking Calamity of the Hour[1].
data.footnotes: [1] The Striking Calamity is one of the names of the Day of Judgment.

data.price: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.
And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm[2]
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ
data.footnotes: [2] Or by a cold windstorm.

meta.transliteration: wa-ammā ʿādun fa-uh'likū birīḥin ṣarṣarin ʿātiyatin

data.price: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
data.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ

meta.transliteration: sakharahā ʿalayhim sabʿa layālin wathamāniyata ayyāmin ḥusūman fatarā al-qawma fīhā ṣarʿā ka-annahum aʿjāzu nakhlin khāwiyatin

data.price: Do you see any trace of them now?
Also, Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed the grave sin,
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ

meta.transliteration: wajāa fir'ʿawnu waman qablahu wal-mu'tafikātu bil-khāṭi-ati

data.price: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.
data.arabic: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً

meta.transliteration: faʿaṣaw rasūla rabbihim fa-akhadhahum akhdhatan rābiyatan

data.price: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark[3],
data.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [3] Which was made by Noah with Allah's command.

meta.transliteration: innā lammā ṭaghā al-māu ḥamalnākum fī al-jāriyati

data.price: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.
data.arabic: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ

meta.transliteration: linajʿalahā lakum tadhkiratan wataʿiyahā udhunun wāʿiyatun
translations: and would be conscious of it

data.price: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

meta.transliteration: fa-idhā nufikha fī al-ṣūri nafkhatun wāḥidatun

data.price: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,
data.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ

meta.transliteration: waḥumilati al-arḍu wal-jibālu fadukkatā dakkatan wāḥidatan

data.price: on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.
And the sky will split asunder and will be frail[4] on that day,
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., weak and unstable.

data.price: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ

meta.transliteration: wal-malaku ʿalā arjāihā wayaḥmilu ʿarsha rabbika fawqahum yawma-idhin thamāniyatun

data.price: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ

meta.transliteration: yawma-idhin tuʿ'raḍūna lā takhfā minkum khāfiyatun

data.price: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

meta.transliteration: fa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu biyamīnihi fayaqūlu hāumu iq'raū kitābiyah

data.price: I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”
So he will be in a pleasant life,
in a lofty garden,
with clustered fruit within his reach.
[They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did[5] in the days gone by.”
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [5] Lit., "advanced" anticipating the reward in the Hereafter.

meta.transliteration: kulū wa-ish'rabū hanīan bimā aslaftum fī al-ayāmi al-khāliyati

data.price: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

meta.transliteration: wa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu bishimālihi fayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ūta kitābiyah

data.price: nor had I known anything of my reckoning!
Would that it [i.e., death] had been the end of me[6]!
data.footnotes: [6] Rather than a gateway to eternal life.

data.price: My wealth has been of no avail to me.
My authority has vanished[7].”
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., I have no valid argument or authority today.

data.price: [It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,
then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,
then tie him up with a chain of seventy cubits long.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ

meta.transliteration: thumma fī sil'silatin dharʿuhā sabʿūna dhirāʿan fa-us'lukūhu

data.price: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

meta.transliteration: innahu kāna lā yu'minu bil-lahi al-ʿaẓīmi

data.price: nor did he encourage feeding the needy.
So Today he will have no close friend here,
nor any food except the discharge of wounds,
none will eat it except the sinners.”
I swear by what you can see.
and what you cannot see!
Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger[8],
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., recited by Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

data.price: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ

meta.transliteration: wamā huwa biqawli shāʿirin qalīlan mā tu'minūna

data.price: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!
data.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ

meta.transliteration: walā biqawli kāhinin qalīlan mā tadhakkarūna

data.price: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
If he had falsely attributed something to Us,
We would have surely seized him by the right hand[9],
data.footnotes: [9] Or "by [Our] Right Hand," i.e., Allah would have surely exacted revenge with might and power.

data.price: then severed his aorta[10],
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., his life artery of the heart; causing immediate death.

data.price: and none of you could have rescued him.
data.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ

meta.transliteration: famā minkum min aḥadin ʿanhu ḥājizīna

data.price: This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.
And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,
and it[11] will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., denying this Qur’an.

data.price: And this[12] is indeed the absolute truth.
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., this Qur’an.

data.price: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
A challenger asked for a punishment bound to come[1]
data.footnotes: [1] In the Hereafter. The pagans of Makkah had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) in ridicule by asking Allah to bring upon them His punishment. See 8:32.

data.price: upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
from Allah, Lord of the pathways of ascent,
by which the angels and the Spirit[2] will ascend to Him on a Day[3] the length of which is fifty thousand years.
data.arabic: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
data.footnotes:
[2] i.e., the angel Gabriel.
 [3] The Day of Judgment will be an extremely long day.

meta.transliteration: taʿruju al-malāikatu wal-rūḥu ilayhi fī yawmin kāna miq'dāruhu khamsīna alfa sanatin

data.price: So be patient [O Prophet] with beautiful patience.
Indeed, they see this [punishment] far off,
but We see it to be close at hand.
On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass[4]
data.footnotes: [4] Or "murky oil."

data.price: and the mountains will be like dyed wool[5],
data.footnotes: [5] While disintegrating.

data.price: and no close friend will ask about another,
even though they will see one another. The wicked will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by offering his children,
data.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ

meta.transliteration: yubaṣṣarūnahum yawaddu al-muj'rimu law yaftadī min ʿadhābi yawmi-idhin bibanīhi
translations: They will be made to see each other

data.price: and his wife and his brother,
and his kindred who stood by him,
and everyone on earth, just to save himself.
data.arabic: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

meta.transliteration: waman fī al-arḍi jamīʿan thumma yunjīhi

data.price: By no means![6] It is a raging Flame,
data.footnotes: [6] An emphatic denial, meaning "It will never be."

data.price: that will strip off the scalps[7].
data.footnotes: [7] Referring to the skin of the head or of the body extremities, which will be burned away by severe heat and flames.

translations: of the skin of the head

data.price: It will call everyone who turned their backs and disobeyed,
and amassed and hoarded wealth.
Indeed, man was created impatient:
when evil befalls him, he bewails,
but when good fortune comes his way, he becomes tight-fisted –
except those who pray,
who are steadfast in their prayers;
and who give a due share[8] of their wealth
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., obligatory charity; zakah.

data.price: to the beggar and the dispossessed;
and who firmly believe in the Day of Judgment;
and those who fear the punishment of their Lord –
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

meta.transliteration: wa-alladhīna hum min ʿadhābi rabbihim mush'fiqūna

data.price: for none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment –
and those who guard their private parts[9],
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., their chastity and honor from immoralities.

data.price: except from their wives or bondwomen[10] whom they own, for then they are not to be blamed.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., female slaves or slave-girls.

meta.transliteration: illā ʿalā azwājihim aw mā malakat aymānuhum fa-innahum ghayru malūmīna

data.price: But whoever seeks beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.
data.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

meta.transliteration: famani ib'taghā warāa dhālika fa-ulāika humu al-ʿādūna

data.price: and those who fulfill their trusts and pledges;
and who are upright in their testimonies;
and who take due care of their prayers;
they will be honored in gardens[11].
data.footnotes: [11] Of Paradise.

data.price: What is the matter with the disbelievers that they are rushing towards you [O Prophet][12],
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., rushing to deny you.

data.price: from the right and from the left, in crowds[13]?
data.footnotes: [13] Some pagans of Makkah gathered around the Prophet (ﷺ) mocking and opposing him, claiming that if there is in fact a Hereafter, they would enter Paradise before the believers.

data.price: Does everyone of them aspire to enter a garden of bliss?
data.arabic: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ

meta.transliteration: ayaṭmaʿu kullu im'ri-in min'hum an yud'khala jannata naʿīmin

data.price: By no means! We have created them from what they know[14].
data.footnotes: [14] i.e., from a disdained fluid.

data.price: I swear by the Lord of the sunrises and sunsets[15] that We are surely Capable
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., Allah is the One Who determines the daily points of sunrise and sunset according to each season by the rotation of the earth around its axis.

meta.transliteration: falā uq'simu birabbi al-mashāriqi wal-maghāribi innā laqādirūna

data.price: to replace them with others better than them, and none can escape Our decree.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

meta.transliteration: ʿalā an nubaddila khayran min'hum wamā naḥnu bimasbūqīna

data.price: So leave them to engage in their falsehood and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised;
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

meta.transliteration: fadharhum yakhūḍū wayalʿabū ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumu alladhī yūʿadūna

data.price: the Day when they will rush out of their graves as if they are racing towards an idol[16],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., just as they used to race towards a newly appointed idol, to be among the first of its worshipers.

meta.transliteration: yawma yakhrujūna mina al-ajdāthi sirāʿan ka-annahum ilā nuṣubin yūfiḍūna

data.price: with their eyes downcast and overwhelmed with disgrace. That is the Day that they were promised.
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ

meta.transliteration: khāshiʿatan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillatun dhālika al-yawmu alladhī kānū yūʿadūna

data.price: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

meta.transliteration: innā arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi an andhir qawmaka min qabli an yatiyahum ʿadhābun alīmun

data.price: He said: “O my people, indeed I am a clear warner to you,
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ

meta.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi innī lakum nadhīrun mubīnun

data.price: that you worship Allah and fear Him, and obey me;
He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite until an appointed term[1]. Indeed, when Allah’s appointed term comes, it cannot be delayed, if you only knew!”
data.arabic: يَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., until the time your life comes to an end.

meta.transliteration: yaghfir lakum min dhunūbikum wayu-akhir'kum ilā ajalin musamman inna ajala al-lahi idhā jāa lā yu-akharu law kuntum taʿlamūna

data.price: He said, “My Lord, I have surely called my people night and day,
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا

meta.transliteration: qāla rabbi innī daʿawtu qawmī laylan wanahāran

data.price: but my call only drove them further away.
Every time I call them so that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and cover their faces with their garments[2], and persist in obstinacy and grow extremely arrogant.
data.arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
data.footnotes: [2] Refusing to see me or listen to my call.

meta.transliteration: wa-innī kullamā daʿawtuhum litaghfira lahum jaʿalū aṣābiʿahum fī ādhānihim wa-is'taghshaw thiyābahum wa-aṣarrū wa-is'takbarū is'tik'bāran

data.price: Then I called them openly,
then I addressed them in public and in private,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارٗا

meta.transliteration: thumma innī aʿlantu lahum wa-asrartu lahum is'rāran

data.price: I said, ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving.
data.arabic: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارٗا

meta.transliteration: faqul'tu is'taghfirū rabbakum innahu kāna ghaffāran

data.price: He will shower you with abundant rain from the sky,
and He will give you wealth and children, and bestow upon you gardens and rivers.
data.arabic: وَيُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَٰلٖ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَٰرٗا

meta.transliteration: wayum'did'kum bi-amwālin wabanīna wayajʿal lakum jannātin wayajʿal lakum anhāran

data.price: What is the matter with you that you do not fear the Majesty of Allah[3],
data.arabic: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارٗا
data.footnotes: [3] While disobeying Him carelessly.

meta.transliteration: mā lakum lā tarjūna lillahi waqāran

data.price: when He has created you in stages[4]?
data.footnotes: [4] See 22:5 and 23:12-14 for the stages of the embryo.

data.price: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one above another,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡاْ كَيۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗا

meta.transliteration: alam taraw kayfa khalaqa al-lahu sabʿa samāwātin ṭibāqan

data.price: and has placed the moon therein as a light and the sun as a burning lamp?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجٗا

meta.transliteration: wajaʿala al-qamara fīhinna nūran wajaʿala al-shamsa sirājan

data.price: Allah has produced you from the earth like a plant[5],
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., your father Adam, whom Allah created from clay.

data.price: then He will return you into it and then will bring you out again.
Allah has made the earth widespread for you
so that you may tread its spacious paths[6].’”
data.footnotes: [6] In the pursuit of a lawful livelihood.

data.price: Noah said, “My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children did not increase them except in loss[7].
data.arabic: قَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِي وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَن لَّمۡ يَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the lowly people among them followed their wealthy chiefs.

meta.transliteration: qāla nūḥun rabbi innahum ʿaṣawnī wa-ittabaʿū man lam yazid'hu māluhu wawaladuhu illā khasāran

data.price: They have contrived a mighty plot,
They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods; and do not abandon Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth, Ya‘ūq, and Nasr[8].’
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدّٗا وَلَا سُوَاعٗا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [8] These were the names of idols named after pious men of past generations before the time of Noah, to commemorate them. In later generations, people started worshiping these idols.

meta.transliteration: waqālū lā tadharunna ālihatakum walā tadharunna waddan walā suwāʿan walā yaghūtha wayaʿūqa wanasran

data.price: They have led many astray. So [O Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّواْ كَثِيرٗاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلٗا

meta.transliteration: waqad aḍallū kathīran walā tazidi al-ẓālimīna illā ḍalālan

data.price: Because of their sins, they were drowned and then were cast into the Fire, and they did not find any helpers against Allah.
data.arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُواْ فَأُدۡخِلُواْ نَارٗا فَلَمۡ يَجِدُواْ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارٗا

meta.transliteration: mimmā khaṭīātihim ugh'riqū fa-ud'khilū nāran falam yajidū lahum min dūni al-lahi anṣāran

data.price: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave on earth a single disbeliever.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا

meta.transliteration: waqāla nūḥun rabbi lā tadhar ʿalā al-arḍi mina al-kāfirīna dayyāran

data.price: For if You leave them, they will surely lead Your slaves astray and beget none but wicked disbelievers.
data.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ يُضِلُّواْ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓاْ إِلَّا فَاجِرٗا كَفَّارٗا

meta.transliteration: innaka in tadharhum yuḍillū ʿibādaka walā yalidū illā fājiran kaffāran

data.price: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.”
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيۡتِيَ مُؤۡمِنٗا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا

meta.transliteration: rabbi igh'fir lī waliwālidayya waliman dakhala baytiya mu'minan walil'mu'minīna wal-mu'mināti walā tazidi al-ẓālimīna illā tabāran

data.price: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened [to the Qur’an,] and they said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation
data.arabic: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا

meta.transliteration: qul ūḥiya ilayya annahu is'tamaʿa nafarun mina al-jini faqālū innā samiʿ'nā qur'ānan ʿajaban

data.price: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
data.arabic: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا

meta.transliteration: yahdī ilā al-rush'di faāmannā bihi walan nush'rika birabbinā aḥadan

data.price: And that He – our exalted and glorified Lord[1] – has neither taken a wife nor a child;
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1] “Jadd” of Our Lord means His Glory, Grandeur, and Command.

meta.transliteration: wa-annahu taʿālā jaddu rabbinā mā ittakhadha ṣāḥibatan walā waladan

data.price: and that the fool among us [i.e., Satan] used to say outrageous things about Allah[2],
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., Satan tempted humans to believe that Allah has a wife and children, and that the angels are Allah's daughters.

meta.transliteration: wa-annahu kāna yaqūlu safīhunā ʿalā al-lahi shaṭaṭan

data.price: although we thought that humans and jinn would never tell lies about Allah.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annā ẓanannā an lan taqūla al-insu wal-jinu ʿalā al-lahi kadhiban

data.price: And there were some men who used to seek refuge with some jinn, but they only increased them in burden.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annahu kāna rijālun mina al-insi yaʿūdhūna birijālin mina al-jini fazādūhum rahaqan

data.price: They thought, just like you [jinn] thought that Allah would never send any messenger.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annahum ẓannū kamā ẓanantum an lan yabʿatha al-lahu aḥadan

data.price: We have sought to reach heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fire.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annā lamasnā al-samāa fawajadnāhā muli-at ḥarasan shadīdan washuhuban

data.price: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but now anyone who eavesdrops will find a flaming fire waiting for him[3].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [3] After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sent as a messenger, the jinn who used to eavesdrop on heaven and then pass it on to fortune-tellers came to an end.

meta.transliteration: wa-annā kunnā naqʿudu min'hā maqāʿida lilssamʿi faman yastamiʿi al-āna yajid lahu shihāban raṣadan

data.price: We do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends good for them.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annā lā nadrī asharrun urīda biman fī al-arḍi am arāda bihim rabbuhum rashadan

data.price: Among us are some who are righteous and some who are otherwise, for we follow divergent ways[4].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
data.footnotes: [4] In beliefs and religious duties.

meta.transliteration: wa-annā minnā al-ṣāliḥūna waminnā dūna dhālika kunnā ṭarāiqa qidadan

data.price: We have realized that we can never escape Allah on earth, nor can we ever escape Him by fleeing.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-annā ẓanannā an lan nuʿ'jiza al-laha fī al-arḍi walan nuʿ'jizahu haraban

data.price: When we heard the guidance [of the Qur’an], we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will have no fear of curtailment [from his reward] or injustice[5].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., nor will the sins of another be placed upon him.

meta.transliteration: wa-annā lammā samiʿ'nā al-hudā āmannā bihi faman yu'min birabbihi falā yakhāfu bakhsan walā rahaqan

data.price: Among us are some who are Muslims and some who are deviant[6]. Those who accepted Islam have sought the true guidance,
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., deviant from the right way.

meta.transliteration: wa-annā minnā al-mus'limūna waminnā al-qāsiṭūna faman aslama fa-ulāika taḥarraw rashadan

data.price: but those who are deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’”
“If they had remained steadfast on the right way, We would have given them abundant rain,
data.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-allawi is'taqāmū ʿalā al-ṭarīqati la-asqaynāhum māan ghadaqan
translations: surely We (would) have given them to drink

data.price: as a test for them[7]. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[8], He will make him suffer an arduous punishment.
data.arabic: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
data.footnotes:
[7] As to whether they will be grateful for Allah's provisions or not.
 [8] i.e., the Qur’an and obedience to Him.

meta.transliteration: linaftinahum fīhi waman yuʿ'riḍ ʿan dhik'ri rabbihi yasluk'hu ʿadhāban ṣaʿadan

data.price: The mosques[9] are for Allah alone, so do not supplicate anyone along with Allah.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
data.footnotes: [9] "Masjid" here means every place of worship on earth.

meta.transliteration: wa-anna al-masājida lillahi falā tadʿū maʿa al-lahi aḥadan

data.price: Yet when the slave of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they swarmed around him[10].”
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
data.footnotes: [10] Crowding in the manner of locusts on top of one another in order to hear him (ﷺ). It refers to the jinn or to the Arabs pagans.

meta.transliteration: wa-annahu lammā qāma ʿabdu al-lahi yadʿūhu kādū yakūnūna ʿalayhi libadan

data.price: Say [O Prophet], “I only supplicate my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا

meta.transliteration: qul innamā adʿū rabbī walā ush'riku bihi aḥadan

data.price: Say, “I have no power to harm or benefit you[11].”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., grant you goodness and guidance.

meta.transliteration: qul innī lā amliku lakum ḍarran walā rashadan

data.price: Say, “None can ever protect me from Allah [if I should disobey Him], nor can I ever find refuge except in Him.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا

meta.transliteration: qul innī lan yujīranī mina al-lahi aḥadun walan ajida min dūnihi mul'taḥadan

data.price: I only convey what I receive from Allah and His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever.
data.arabic: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا

meta.transliteration: illā balāghan mina al-lahi warisālātihi waman yaʿṣi al-laha warasūlahu fa-inna lahu nāra jahannama khālidīna fīhā abadan

data.price: Until when they see what they were promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا

meta.transliteration: ḥattā idhā ra-aw mā yūʿadūna fasayaʿlamūna man aḍʿafu nāṣiran wa-aqallu ʿadadan

data.price: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has appointed a distant time for it.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا

meta.transliteration: qul in adrī aqarībun mā tūʿadūna am yajʿalu lahu rabbī amadan

data.price: [He is] the Knower of the unseen, He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,
data.arabic: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا

meta.transliteration: ʿālimu al-ghaybi falā yuẓ'hiru ʿalā ghaybihi aḥadan

data.price: except the messenger whom He chooses, then He appoints angel-guards before him and behind him[12]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [12] Protecting him so that others do not know what he was informed of the unseen.

meta.transliteration: illā mani ir'taḍā min rasūlin fa-innahu yasluku min bayni yadayhi wamin khalfihi raṣadan

data.price: to ensure[13] that the messengers fully conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge all about them, and keeps count of all things.”
data.arabic: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
data.footnotes: [13] Or "So He may make evident."

meta.transliteration: liyaʿlama an qad ablaghū risālāti rabbihim wa-aḥāṭa bimā ladayhim wa-aḥṣā kulla shayin ʿadadan

data.price: O you the enwrapped one[1],
data.footnotes: [1] Allah is addressing the Messenger (ﷺ), who was wrapped in his garments.

data.price: Stand up in prayer at night except a little,
half of it, or a little less,
or a little more, and recite the Qur’an at a measured pace.
data.arabic: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا

meta.transliteration: aw zid ʿalayhi warattili al-qur'āna tartīlan

data.price: We will send down upon you a heavy Word[2].
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., the revelation, which the Prophet (ﷺ) would feel its great weight when descending upon him. Also, it is heavy for its ordinances, rulings, punishments, ethics, etc.

data.price: Indeed, worship at night is more effective[3] and more conducive to proper recitation[4].
data.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[3] Or "getting up at night is more difficult...," meaning that it can only be done by sincere believers.
 [4] i.e., for reciting, hearing, and understanding of the Qur’an.

meta.transliteration: inna nāshi-ata al-layli hiya ashaddu waṭan wa-aqwamu qīlan

data.price: In the daytime, you have plenty of time for your worldly matters.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: inna laka fī al-nahāri sabḥan ṭawīlan

data.price: And remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself completely to Him.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-udh'kuri is'ma rabbika watabattal ilayhi tabtīlan

data.price: [He is] Lord of the east and the west; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, so take Him as the Disposer of your affairs[5].
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., trust in Allah and rely upon Him in all your matters.

meta.transliteration: rabbu al-mashriqi wal-maghribi lā ilāha illā huwa fa-ittakhidh'hu wakīlan

data.price: Bear patiently what they say, and avoid them in a gracious manner.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: wa-iṣ'bir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wa-uh'jur'hum hajran jamīlan

data.price: Leave to Me the deniers who are having a life of luxury, and bear with them for a little while.
data.arabic: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا

meta.transliteration: wadharnī wal-mukadhibīna ulī al-naʿmati wamahhil'hum qalīlan

data.price: Indeed, We have heavy shackles and a Blazing Fire,
and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,
on the Day when the earth and the mountains will convulse, and the mountains will be like dunes of loose sand.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا

meta.transliteration: yawma tarjufu al-arḍu wal-jibālu wakānati al-jibālu kathīban mahīlan

data.price: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger to be a witness over you, just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا

meta.transliteration: innā arsalnā ilaykum rasūlan shāhidan ʿalaykum kamā arsalnā ilā fir'ʿawna rasūlan

data.price: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe punishment.
data.arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: faʿaṣā fir'ʿawnu al-rasūla fa-akhadhnāhu akhdhan wabīlan

data.price: If you disbelieve, then how will you protect yourselves against a Day that will turn children’s hair gray?
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا

meta.transliteration: fakayfa tattaqūna in kafartum yawman yajʿalu al-wil'dāna shīban

data.price: It will cause the sky to break asunder[6]. His promise will certainly be fulfilled.
data.arabic: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
data.footnotes: [6] Out of the terror of that Day.

meta.transliteration: al-samāu munfaṭirun bihi kāna waʿduhu mafʿūlan

data.price: Indeed, this is a reminder; so whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا

meta.transliteration: inna hādhihi tadhkiratun faman shāa ittakhadha ilā rabbihi sabīlan

data.price: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you[7]. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan[8]. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward[9]. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
data.footnotes:
[7] The ruling mentioned at the beginning of this surah is lightened here. So from now on, the believers do not have to stick to any of the portions specified there; rather, they can pray whatever they can at night. It is out of the mercy of Allah upon His servants that He does not want hardship for them.
 [8] i.e., giving in charity and for His causes.
 [9] It will be rewarded tenfold, or 700-fold, and Allah gives even more to whoever He wills. See 2:261.

meta.transliteration: inna rabbaka yaʿlamu annaka taqūmu adnā min thuluthayi al-layli waniṣ'fahu wathuluthahu waṭāifatun mina alladhīna maʿaka wal-lahu yuqaddiru al-layla wal-nahāra ʿalima an lan tuḥ'ṣūhu fatāba ʿalaykum fa-iq'raū mā tayassara mina al-qur'āni ʿalima an sayakūnu minkum marḍā waākharūna yaḍribūna fī al-arḍi yabtaghūna min faḍli al-lahi waākharūna yuqātilūna fī sabīli al-lahi fa-iq'raū mā tayassara min'hu wa-aqīmū al-ṣalata waātū al-zakata wa-aqriḍū al-laha qarḍan ḥasanan wamā tuqaddimū li-anfusikum min khayrin tajidūhu ʿinda al-lahi huwa khayran wa-aʿẓama ajran wa-is'taghfirū al-laha inna al-laha ghafūrun raḥīmun

data.price: O you covered [in your cloak][1],
data.footnotes: [1] It refers to the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: arise and warn,
and proclaim the greatness of your Lord,
and purify your garments,
and shun idol worshiping[2],
data.footnotes: [2] And other sins and bad conducts and morals.

data.price: and do not do a favor for a greater return[3],
data.footnotes: [3] Or: do not consider your good deeds as a favor to Allah, thinking of your little deeds as abundant.

data.price: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.
When the Trumpet is sounded[4],
data.footnotes: [4] For the second time, causing all to rise from the dead for resurrection. See 39:68.

data.price: that Day will be a difficult day,
not easy for the disbelievers.
Leave me to deal with the one whom I created lonely[5],
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., having no wealth or children. It refers to al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah, who was impressed by the Qur’an, yet he publicly denied it to win the approval of the pagans of Makkah.

data.price: and gave him abundant wealth,
and sons by his side,
and gave him a life of comfort and power,
yet he aspires that I should give him more.
By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses.
I will subject him to an unbearable punishment.
For he reflected and plotted [against the Qur’an][6].
data.footnotes: [6] In order to discredit it.

data.price: May he perish, how he plotted!
Again, may he perish, how he plotted!
Then he looked around,
then he frowned and scowled,
then turned away with arrogance,
then said, “This is nothing but magic from the past.
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

meta.transliteration: faqāla in hādhā illā siḥ'run yu'tharu

data.price: This is nothing but the words of a man.”
Soon I will make him burn in the Scorching Fire[7].
data.footnotes: [7] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.

data.price: How do you know what Scorching Fire is?
It leaves nothing and spares no one,
scorching the skin.
It is overseen by nineteen [angels].

We have only appointed angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have only made their number as a test for the disbelievers[8], so that those who were given the Scripture may have certainty and the believers may increase in faith; and neither those who were given the Scripture nor the believers may have any doubts; and so that those [hypocrites] in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may say, “What does Allah mean by this number?” Thus Allah causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills, and none knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. This is but a reminder to mankind.
data.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ
data.footnotes: [8] To say what they want to say, so their punishment will be multiplied for them. Abu Jahl, one of the chief pagans in Makkah, made fun of the Prophet (ﷺ) when they came to know that the keepers of Hell are nineteen angels, so he ridiculed this number and said that it is an easy number to overcome.

meta.transliteration: wamā jaʿalnā aṣḥāba al-nāri illā malāikatan wamā jaʿalnā ʿiddatahum illā fit'natan lilladhīna kafarū liyastayqina alladhīna ūtū al-kitāba wayazdāda alladhīna āmanū īmānan walā yartāba alladhīna ūtū al-kitāba wal-mu'minūna waliyaqūla alladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun wal-kāfirūna mādhā arāda al-lahu bihādhā mathalan kadhālika yuḍillu al-lahu man yashāu wayahdī man yashāu wamā yaʿlamu junūda rabbika illā huwa wamā hiya illā dhik'rā lil'bashari

data.price: No indeed! By the moon,
and by the night when it departs,
and by the dawn when it brightens,
Hellfire is indeed one of the greatest matters,
a warning to mankind,
to whoever among you chooses to advance or regress.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ

meta.transliteration: liman shāa minkum an yataqaddama aw yata-akhara

data.price: Every soul is held in pledge[9] for its deeds,
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., held responsible.

data.price: except the People of the Right[10],
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., the believers who receive their records of deeds in their right hands.

data.price: who will be in gardens, asking one another
about the wicked:
“What brought you to Hell?”
They will say, “We were not among those who prayed,
nor did we feed the poor,
and we indulged in falsehood along with those who indulged in it,
and we denied the Day of Judgment,
until the certainty [of death] came to us.”
So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.
Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from the Reminder,
as if they were terrified wild asses,
fleeing from a lion?
In fact, each one of them desires that open [divine] letters be sent to each of them[11].
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [11] Instead of Muhammad (ﷺ), not due to the lack of proofs or signs presented to them but out of obstinacy and arrogance.

meta.transliteration: bal yurīdu kullu im'ri-in min'hum an yu'tā ṣuḥufan munasharatan

data.price: By no means! They rather do not fear the Hereafter.
No indeed! This [Qur’an] is a reminder.
So whoever wills may take heed.
But they will not take heed unless Allah so wills. He is most worthy to be feared and most worthy to forgive.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

meta.transliteration: wamā yadhkurūna illā an yashāa al-lahu huwa ahlu al-taqwā wa-ahlu al-maghfirati

data.price: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,
and I swear by the self-reproaching soul[1]!
data.footnotes: [1] Of the believer, which blames oneself whenever falls into sin or error.

data.price: Does man think that We cannot reassemble his bones?
In fact, We are able to restore even his very fingertips.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ

meta.transliteration: balā qādirīna ʿalā an nusawwiya banānahu

data.price: But man desires to persist in sin[2],
data.footnotes: [2] While denying the coming of the Day of Judgment.

data.price: and asks [mockingly], “When is the Day of Resurrection?”
But when the sight is dazzled,
and the moon is darkened,
and the sun and the moon are brought together[3],
data.footnotes: [3] They both have never been together since they were created. On this Day they will be brought together, darkened, and both will be thrown into the Hell; so that all should know that they were subservient created beings, especially those who worshiped them.

data.price: on that Day man will say, “Where is the escape?”
No indeed! There will be no refuge.
On that Day all will end up before your Lord.
On that Day man will be informed of what he has sent forth[4] and left behind[5].
data.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes:
[4] i.e., of his deeds for the Hereafter.
 [5] i.e., that which he failed to do.

meta.transliteration: yunabba-u al-insānu yawma-idhin bimā qaddama wa-akhara

data.price: In fact, man will be a witness against himself[6],
data.footnotes: [6] His organs will testify against him, as mentioned in 36:65 and 41:20-23.

data.price: despite the excuses he may put forward.
Do not move your tongue [O Prophet] in haste trying to memorize it.
data.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

meta.transliteration: lā tuḥarrik bihi lisānaka litaʿjala bihi

data.price: It is upon Us to make you memorize and recite it.
Then when We recite it [through Gabriel], follow its recitation attentively;
then it is upon Us to explain its meanings.
No indeed! You [people] love this fleeting world,
and neglect the Hereafter.
On that Day some faces will be bright,
looking at their Lord[7].
data.footnotes: [7] The dwellers of Paradise will be granted the honor of actually seeing their Lord in the Hereafter.

data.price: And on that Day, some faces will be gloomy,
knowing that a crushing calamity will befall them.
Indeed, when the soul reaches the throat[8],
data.footnotes: [8] Upon death.

data.price: and it is said, “Is there any healer?”
And he realizes that it is time to depart,
when legs are brought together [in a shroud][9];
data.footnotes: [9] The difficulties the person faces while leaving this world and moving on to the Hereafter; or the people arrange for the departure of his body, while angels arrange for the departure of his soul.

data.price: on that Day, he will be driven to your Lord.
He neither believed nor prayed;
rather he denied and turned away,
then he went to his people, elated with pride,
Woe to you, and woe!
Again, woe to you, and woe!
Does man think that he will be left neglected[10]?
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., without purpose and responsibility, or without returning to Allah for account.

data.price: Was he not once a drop of semen emitted,
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

meta.transliteration: alam yaku nuṭ'fatan min maniyyin yum'nā

data.price: then he became a clinging clot[11], then He created him and perfected his form,
data.footnotes: [11] "‘Alaqah": an embryo that resembles a leech.

data.price: and made from him both genders, male and female?
Is not He able to bring the dead back to life?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

meta.transliteration: alaysa dhālika biqādirin ʿalā an yuḥ'yiya al-mawtā

data.price: Was there not a period of time when man was not a thing [even] mentioned[1]?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا
data.footnotes: [1] Before coming into being.

meta.transliteration: hal atā ʿalā al-insāni ḥīnun mina al-dahri lam yakun shayan madhkūran

data.price: Indeed, We created man from a drop of mixed fluids[2], in order to test him. So We gave him hearing and sight.
data.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
data.footnotes: [2] A combination of male and female gametes (sperm and egg) which form the zygote after fertilization in the womb.

meta.transliteration: innā khalaqnā al-insāna min nuṭ'fatin amshājin nabtalīhi fajaʿalnāhu samīʿan baṣīran

data.price: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

meta.transliteration: innā hadaynāhu al-sabīla immā shākiran wa-immā kafūran

data.price: We have surely prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا

meta.transliteration: innā aʿtadnā lil'kāfirīna salāsilā wa-aghlālan wasaʿīran

data.price: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] flavored with camphor[3],
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
data.footnotes: [3] "Kāfoor": a sweet-scent spring in Paradise.

meta.transliteration: inna al-abrāra yashrabūna min kasin kāna mizājuhā kāfūran

data.price: a spring from which Allah’s slaves will drink, which will flow as they wish.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا

meta.transliteration: ʿaynan yashrabu bihā ʿibādu al-lahi yufajjirūnahā tafjīran

data.price: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will spread far and wide,
data.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا

meta.transliteration: yūfūna bil-nadhri wayakhāfūna yawman kāna sharruhu mus'taṭīran

data.price: and they give food, despite their love for it[4], to the needy, the orphans, and the captives,
data.arabic: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
data.footnotes: [4] Or "out of love for Him (Allah)".

meta.transliteration: wayuṭ'ʿimūna al-ṭaʿāma ʿalā ḥubbihi mis'kīnan wayatīman wa-asīran

data.price: [saying to themselves] “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we seek from you neither reward nor gratitude.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا

meta.transliteration: innamā nuṭ'ʿimukum liwajhi al-lahi lā nurīdu minkum jazāan walā shukūran

data.price: We fear from our Lord a grim and distressful Day.”
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا

meta.transliteration: innā nakhāfu min rabbinā yawman ʿabūsan qamṭarīran

data.price: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day, and will grant them radiance and delight,
data.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا

meta.transliteration: fawaqāhumu al-lahu sharra dhālika al-yawmi walaqqāhum naḍratan wasurūran
translations: and will cause them to meet

data.price: and will reward them for their perseverance with Paradise and garments of silk.
They will recline therein on adorned couches; neither feeling scorching heat[5] nor freezing cold.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the sun.

meta.transliteration: muttakiīna fīhā ʿalā al-arāiki lā yarawna fīhā shamsan walā zamharīran

data.price: with shady branches spread above them, and clusters of fruit will be made within their reach.
data.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: wadāniyatan ʿalayhim ẓilāluhā wadhullilat quṭūfuhā tadhlīlan

data.price: They will be served frequently with silver vessels and crystal cups,
data.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠

meta.transliteration: wayuṭāfu ʿalayhim biāniyatin min fiḍḍatin wa-akwābin kānat qawārīrā

data.price: crystalline goblets of silver, filled precisely as desired.
They will be given a glass [of wine] flavored with ginger
data.arabic: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

meta.transliteration: wayus'qawna fīhā kasan kāna mizājuhā zanjabīlan
translations: And they will be given to drink

data.price: from a spring therein called Salsabīl.
They will be served by eternal young boys; if you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا

meta.transliteration: wayaṭūfu ʿalayhim wil'dānun mukhalladūna idhā ra-aytahum ḥasib'tahum lu'lu-an manthūran

data.price: If you were to look around, you would see bliss and a vast dominion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا

meta.transliteration: wa-idhā ra-ayta thamma ra-ayta naʿīman wamul'kan kabīran

data.price: They will be dressed in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
data.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا

meta.transliteration: ʿāliyahum thiyābu sundusin khuḍ'run wa-is'tabraqun waḥullū asāwira min fiḍḍatin wasaqāhum rabbuhum sharāban ṭahūran
translations: and will give them to drink

data.price: [And they will be told,] “Indeed, this is your reward, and your efforts have been appreciated.”
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

meta.transliteration: inna hādhā kāna lakum jazāan wakāna saʿyukum mashkūran

data.price: Indeed, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to you in stages.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: innā naḥnu nazzalnā ʿalayka al-qur'āna tanzīlan

data.price: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not obey any sinner or disbeliever from among them.
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا

meta.transliteration: fa-iṣ'bir liḥuk'mi rabbika walā tuṭiʿ min'hum āthiman aw kafūran

data.price: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening[6],
data.footnotes: [6] This and the next verse refer to the five daily prayers: here it refers to the dawn prayer, then the noon and afternoon prayers.

data.price: and prostrate to Him at night, and glorify Him at length by night[7].
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا
data.footnotes: [7] It refers to the sunset and night prayers.

meta.transliteration: wamina al-layli fa-us'jud lahu wasabbiḥ'hu laylan ṭawīlan

data.price: Indeed, these [pagans] love this fleeting life and pay no heed to a heavy Day ahead of them.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: inna hāulāi yuḥibbūna al-ʿājilata wayadharūna warāahum yawman thaqīlan

data.price: It is We Who created them and strengthened their build. If We will, We can replace them with others like them.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا

meta.transliteration: naḥnu khalaqnāhum washadadnā asrahum wa-idhā shi'nā baddalnā amthālahum tabdīlan

data.price: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who wills may take a way to his Lord.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا

meta.transliteration: inna hādhihi tadhkiratun faman shāa ittakhadha ilā rabbihi sabīlan

data.price: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا

meta.transliteration: wamā tashāūna illā an yashāa al-lahu inna al-laha kāna ʿalīman ḥakīman

data.price: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but for the wrongdoers He has prepared a painful punishment.
data.arabic: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا

meta.transliteration: yud'khilu man yashāu fī raḥmatihi wal-ẓālimīna aʿadda lahum ʿadhāban alīman

data.price: By those [winds] sent forth in succession,
those that blow violently,
and scatter [rainclouds] far and wide,
And by those [angels] who bring criterion[1];
data.footnotes: [1] To Allah's messengers to distinguish between truth and falsehood.

data.price: and those who deliver revelation,
leaving no excuse or giving warning –
what you are promised will surely come to pass.
So when the stars are effaced,
and when the sky is split apart,
and when the mountains are blown away,
and when the messengers are summoned[2],
data.footnotes: [2] To testify concerning their nations.

translations: are gathered to their appointed time

data.price: until which Day has all this been postponed?
Until the Day of Judgment.
How do you know what the Day of Judgment is?
Woe on that Day to the deniers[3]!
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., Death and destruction be upon them.

data.price: Did We not destroy the earlier nations?
Then We will do likewise to the later ones.
This is how We deal with the wicked.
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
Did We not create you from a worthless fluid,
then We placed it in a secure repository
for a determined period[4]?
For We determined it; How excellently We determine!
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
Have We not made the earth a receptacle[5]
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., a lodging, a container that contains all people.

data.price: for the living and the dead,
and placed therein firm towering mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا

meta.transliteration: wajaʿalnā fīhā rawāsiya shāmikhātin wa-asqaynākum māan furātan
translations: and We gave you to drink

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
[They will be told,] “Proceed to that [Fire] which you used to deny!
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

meta.transliteration: inṭaliqū ilā mā kuntum bihi tukadhibūna

data.price: Proceed to the shadow [of smoke] ascending in three columns,
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

meta.transliteration: inṭaliqū ilā ẓillin dhī thalāthi shuʿabin

data.price: that provides neither shade nor protection from the flames.
data.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

meta.transliteration: lā ẓalīlin walā yugh'nī mina al-lahabi

data.price: Indeed, it [i.e., Hell] throws up sparks as big as castles,
as if they were tawny camels[6].
data.footnotes: [6] i.e., huge and black camels.

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
On that Day they won’t speak,
nor will they be allowed to make excuses.
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
[They will be told,] “This is the Day of Judgment: We have gathered you along with the earlier generations.
So if you have any scheme, then plot it against Me.”
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
Indeed, the righteous will be amid shades and springs
and will have whatever fruit they desire.
[They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully, as a reward for what you used to do.”
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

meta.transliteration: kulū wa-ish'rabū hanīan bimā kuntum taʿmalūna

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
“Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while; you are truly wicked.”
Woe on that Day to the deniers!
When it is said to them, “Bow [in prayer],” they do not bow.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ

meta.transliteration: wa-idhā qīla lahumu ir'kaʿū lā yarkaʿūna

data.price: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
In which message after this [Qur’an] will they believe?

version.title: English Translation - Rowwad Translation Center
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into Englsih by Rowwad Translation Center in cooperation with Islamhouse.com
